title: 'No concern over Janssen form'
text:
Mauricio Pochettino not concerned about Vincent Janssen's poor Tottenham form Last Updated: 28/01/17 8:58am Vincent Janssen has scored just three goals for Tottenham since a £17m move from AZ Alkmaar Mauricio Pochettino says he is not concerned about Vincent Janssen's poor goalscoring return at Tottenham. 
Janssen has scored just three goals for Spurs this season following a £17m move from AZ Alkmaar in the summer. 
He will be given the chance to improve that tally when Wycombe Wanderers travel to White Hart Lane for an FA Cup fourth-round tie on Saturday . 
But Pochettino insists he still "trusts in" the striker, although he admits the player has struggled for form in recent months. 
Pochettino said: "For me, it is not an issue. Janssen is not in his best moment but he is young, it is first season and we have had a lot of chats with him. Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino has backed summer signing Vincent Janssen to come good 
"It's normal. It's all new for him and he needs to be relaxed, train hard, try to improve and when he has the opportunity to play show his quality. But it is not a major issue. 
"We will see what happens on Saturday. The most important thing is we believe in him and trust in him. But it is not because in the last few months he has struggled a little bit in his performances that created doubts in us. 
"I think if he has the possibility to play he is ready to give his best. If not he must wait on the bench for another opportunity but I have no doubt about him." Also See:
